intro: Angraecopsis meliantha, commonly known as the starry orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant produces a single, showy inflorescence with numerous small, fragrant blooms. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, arid conditions of its native habitat. Angraecopsis meliantha is known for its unique pollination mechanism, relying on specific nocturnal moths for reproduction.
